013package org.apache.juneau.parser;
014
015import java.io.*;
016
017import org.apache.juneau.internal.*;
018
019/**
020 * Similar to a {@link java.io.PushbackReader} with a pushback buffer of 1 character.
021 *
022 * <p>
023 * Code is optimized to work with a 1 character buffer.
024 *
025 * <p>
026 * Additionally keeps track of current line and column number, and provides the ability to set mark points and capture
027 * characters from the previous mark point.
028 *
029 * <ul class='notes'>
030 *    <li class='warn'>This class is not thread safe.
031 * </ul>
032 *
033 * <ul class='seealso'>
034 *    <li class='link'><a class="doclink" href="../../../../overview-summary.html#juneau-marshall.jm.SerializersAndParsers">Serializers and Parsers</a>
035
036 * </ul>
037 */
038public class ParserReader extends Reader implements Positionable {
039
040   /** Wrapped reader */
041   protected final Reader r;
042
043   private char[] buff;       // Internal character buffer
044   private int line = 1;      // Current line number
045   private int column;        // Current column number
046   private int iCurrent = 0;  // Current pointer into character buffer
047   private int iMark = -1;    // Mark position in buffer
048   private int iEnd = 0;      // The last good character position in the buffer
049   private boolean endReached, holesExist;
050   private final boolean unbuffered;
051
052   /**
053    * Constructor.
054    *
055    * @param pipe The parser input.
056    * @throws IOException Thrown by underlying stream.
057    */
058   public ParserReader(ParserPipe pipe) throws IOException {
059      this.unbuffered = pipe.unbuffered;
060      if (pipe.isString()) {
061         String in = pipe.getInputAsString();
062         this.r = new CharSequenceReader(in);
063         this.buff = new char[in.length() < 1024 ? in.length() : 1024];
064      } else {
065         Reader _r = pipe.getReader();
066         if (_r instanceof ParserReader)
067            this.r = ((ParserReader)_r).r;
068         else
069            this.r = _r;
070         this.buff = new char[1024];
071      }
072      pipe.setPositionable(this);
073   }
074
075   /**
076    * Reads a single character.
077    *
078    * <p>
079    * Note that this method does NOT process extended unicode characters (i.e. characters above 0x10000), but rather
080    * returns them as two <jk>char</jk>s.
081    * Use {@link #readCodePoint()} to ensure proper handling of extended unicode.
082    *
083    * @return The character read, or -1 if the end of the stream has been reached.
084    * @throws IOException If a problem occurred trying to read from the reader.
085    */
086   @Override /* Reader */
087   public final int read() throws IOException {
088      int c = readFromBuff();
089      if (c == -1)
090         return -1;
091      if (c == '\n') {
092         line++;
093         column = 0;
094      } else {
095         column++;
096      }
097      return c;
098   }
099
100   /**
101    * Same as {@link #read()} but skips over any whitespace characters.
102    *
103    * @return The first non-whitespace character, or -1 if the end of stream reached.
104    * @throws IOException Thrown by underlying stream.
105    */
106   public final int readSkipWs() throws IOException {
107      while (true) {
108         int c = read();
109         if (c == -1 || ! Character.isWhitespace(c))
110            return c;
111      }
112   }
113
114   /**
115    * Same as {@link #read()} but detects and combines extended unicode characters (characters above 0x10000).
116    *
117    * @return The character read, or -1 if the end of the stream has been reached.
118    * @throws IOException If a problem occurred trying to read from the reader.
119    */
120   public final int readCodePoint() throws IOException {
121      int c = read();
122
123      // Characters that take up 2 chars.
124      if (c >= 0xd800 && c <= 0xdbff) {
125         int low = read();
126         if (low >= 0xdc00 && low <= 0xdfff)
127            c = 0x10000 + ((c - 0xd800) << 10) + (low - 0xdc00);
128      }
129
130      return c;
131   }
132
133   private final int readFromBuff() throws IOException {
134      while (iCurrent >= iEnd) {
135         if (endReached)
136            return -1;
137
138         // If there's still space at the end of this buffer, fill it.
139         // Make sure there's at least 2 character spaces free for extended unicode characters.
140         //if (false) {
141         if (iEnd+1 < buff.length) {
142            int x = read(buff, iCurrent, buff.length-iEnd);
143            if (x == -1) {
144               endReached = true;
145               return -1;
146            }
147            iEnd += x;
148
149         } else {
150            // If we're currently marking, then we want to copy from the current mark point
151            // to the beginning of the buffer and then fill in the remainder of buffer.
152            if (iMark >= 0) {
153
154               // If we're marking from the beginning of the array, we double the size of the
155               // buffer.  This isn't likely to occur often.
156               if (iMark == 0) {
157                  char[] buff2 = new char[buff.length<<1];
158                  System.arraycopy(buff, 0, buff2, 0, buff.length);
159                  buff = buff2;
160
161               // Otherwise, we copy what's currently marked to the beginning of the buffer.
162               } else {
163                  int copyBuff = iMark;
164                  System.arraycopy(buff, copyBuff, buff, 0, buff.length - copyBuff);
165                  iCurrent -= copyBuff;
166                  iMark -= copyBuff;
167               }
168               int expected = buff.length - iCurrent;
169
170               int x = read(buff, iCurrent, expected);
171               if (x == -1) {
172                  endReached = true;
173                  iEnd = iCurrent;
174                  return -1;
175               }
176               iEnd = iCurrent + x;
177            } else {
178               // Copy the last 10 chars in the buffer to the beginning of the buffer.
179               int copyBuff = Math.min(iCurrent, 10);
180               System.arraycopy(buff, iCurrent-copyBuff, buff, 0, copyBuff);
181
182               // Number of characters we expect to copy on the next read.
183               int expected = buff.length - copyBuff;
184               int x = read(buff, copyBuff, expected);
185               iCurrent = copyBuff;
186               if (x == -1) {
187                  endReached = true;
188                  iEnd = iCurrent;
189                  return -1;
190               }
191               iEnd = iCurrent + x;
192            }
193         }
194      }
195      return buff[iCurrent++];
196   }
197
198   /**
199    * Start buffering the calls to read() so that the text can be gathered from the mark point on calling {@code getFromMarked()}.
200    */
201   public final void mark() {
202      iMark = iCurrent;
203   }
204
205   /**
206    * Peeks the next character in the stream.
207    *
208    * <p>
209    * This is equivalent to doing a {@code read()} followed by an {@code unread()}.
210    *
211    * @return The peeked character, or (char)-1 if the end of the stream has been reached.
212    * @throws IOException If a problem occurred trying to read from the reader.
213    */
214   public final int peek() throws IOException {
215      int c = read();
216      if (c != -1)
217         unread();
218      return c;
219   }
220
221   /**
222    * Same as {@link #peek()} but skips over any whitespace characters.
223    *
224    * <p>
225    * This is equivalent to doing a {@code read()} followed by an {@code unread()}.
226    *
227    * @return The peeked character, or (char)-1 if the end of the stream has been reached.
228    * @throws IOException If a problem occurred trying to read from the reader.
229    */
230   public final int peekSkipWs() throws IOException {
231      while(true) {
232         int c = read();
233         boolean isWs = Character.isWhitespace(c);
234         if (c != -1 && ! isWs)
235            unread();
236         if (! isWs)
237            return c;
238      }
239   }
240
241   /**
242    * Read the specified number of characters off the stream.
243    *
244    * @param num The number of characters to read.
245    * @return The characters packaged as a String.
246    * @throws IOException If a problem occurred trying to read from the reader.
247    */
248   public final String read(int num) throws IOException {
249      char[] c = new char[num];
250      for (int i = 0; i < num; i++) {
251         int c2 = read();
252         if (c2 == -1)
253            return new String(c, 0, i);
254         c[i] = (char)c2;
255      }
256      return new String(c);
257   }
258
259   /**
260    * Pushes the last read character back into the stream.
261    *
262    * @return This object.
263    * @throws IOException If a problem occurred trying to read from the reader.
264    */
265   public ParserReader unread() throws IOException {
266      if (iCurrent <= 0)
267         throw new IOException("Buffer underflow.");
268      iCurrent--;
269      if (column == 0)
270         line--;
271      else
272         column--;
273      return this;
274   }
275
276   /**
277    * No-op.
278    *
279    * <p>
280    * Input readers are closed in the {@link ParserPipe} class.
281    *
282    * @throws IOException If a problem occurred trying to read from the reader.
283    */
284   @Override /* Reader */
285   public void close() throws IOException {
286      // No-op
287   }
288
289   /**
290    * Returns the contents of the reusable character buffer as a string, and resets the buffer for next usage.
291    *
292    * @return The contents of the reusable character buffer as a string.
293    */
294   public final String getMarked() {
295      return getMarked(0, 0);
296   }
297
298   /**
299    * Same as {@link #getMarked()} except allows you to specify offsets into the buffer.
300    *
301    * <p>
302    * For example, to return the marked string, but trim the first and last characters, call the following:
303    * <p class='bjava'>
304    *    getFromMarked(1, -1);
305    * </p>
306    *
307    * @param offsetStart The offset of the start position.
308    * @param offsetEnd The offset of the end position.
309    * @return The contents of the reusable character buffer as a string.
310    */
311   public final String getMarked(int offsetStart, int offsetEnd) {
312      int offset = 0;
313
314      // Holes are \u00FF 'delete' characters that we need to get rid of now.
315      if (holesExist) {
316         for (int i = iMark; i < iCurrent; i++) {
317            char c = buff[i];
318            if (c == 127)
319               offset++;
320            else
321               buff[i-offset] = c;
322         }
323         holesExist = false;
324      }
325      int start = iMark + offsetStart, len = iCurrent - iMark + offsetEnd - offsetStart - offset;
326      String s = new String(buff, start, len);
327      iMark = -1;
328      return s;
329   }
330
331   /**
332    * Trims off the last character in the marking buffer.
333    *
334    * <p>
335    * Useful for removing escape characters from sequences.
336    *
337    * @return This object.
338    */
339   public final ParserReader delete() {
340      return delete(1);
341   }
342
343   /**
344    * Trims off the specified number of last characters in the marking buffer.
345    * Useful for removing escape characters from sequences.
346    *
347    * @param count The number of characters to delete.
348    * @return This object.
349    */
350   public final ParserReader delete(int count) {
351      for (int i = 0; i < count; i++)
352         buff[iCurrent-i-1] = 127;
353      holesExist = true;
354      return this;
355   }
356
357   /**
358    * Replaces the last character in the marking buffer with the specified character.
359    *
360    * <p>
361    * <c>offset</c> must be at least <c>1</c> for normal characters, and <c>2</c> for extended
362    * unicode characters in order for the replacement to fit into the buffer.
363    *
364    * @param c The new character.
365    * @param offset The offset.
366    * @return This object.
367    * @throws IOException Thrown by underlying stream.
368    */
369   public final ParserReader replace(int c, int offset) throws IOException {
370      if (c < 0x10000) {
371         if (offset < 1)
372            throw new IOException("Buffer underflow.");
373         buff[iCurrent-offset] = (char)c;
374      } else {
375         if (offset < 2)
376            throw new IOException("Buffer underflow.");
377         c -= 0x10000;
378         buff[iCurrent-offset] = (char)(0xd800 + (c >> 10));
379         buff[iCurrent-offset+1] = (char)(0xdc00 + (c & 0x3ff));
380         offset--;
381      }
382      // Fill in the gap with DEL characters.
383      for (int i = 1; i < offset; i++)
384         buff[iCurrent-i] = 127;
385      holesExist |= (offset > 1);
386      return this;
387   }
388
389   /**
390    * Replace the last read character in the buffer with the specified character.
391    *
392    * @param c The new character.
393    * @return This object.
394    * @throws IOException Thrown by underlying stream.
395    */
396   public final ParserReader replace(char c) throws IOException {
397      return replace(c, 1);
398   }
399   /**
400    * Reads a numeric string from the specified reader.
401    *
402    * @return The parsed number string.
403    * @throws IOException Thrown by underlying stream.
404    */
405   public String parseNumberString() throws IOException {
406      mark();
407      int c = 0;
408      while (true) {
409         c = read();
410         if (c == -1)
411            break;
412         if (! StringUtils.isNumberChar((char)c)) {
413            unread();
414            break;
415         }
416      }
417      return getMarked();
418   }
419
420   /**
421    * Subclasses can override this method to provide additional filtering.
422    *
423    * <p>
424    * Default implementation simply calls the same method on the underlying reader.
425    */
426   @Override /* Reader */
427   public int read(char[] cbuf, int off, int len) throws IOException {
428      return unbuffered ? r.read(cbuf, off, 1) : r.read(cbuf, off, len);
429   }
430
431   @Override /* Positionable */
432   public Position getPosition() {
433      return new Position(line, column);
434   }
435}
